tasks.title: Project Repository and Environment Setup
tasks.description: Finalize the remaining environment setup for the BIOFOX KOL Admin Dashboard monorepo. Complete CI/CD pipeline (GitHub Actions), Husky pre-commit hooks, and Docker Compose for local development. All other core project configurations are already in place.
tasks.details:
- Monorepo is already set up with Next.js 15, React 19, TypeScript 5.8, PostgreSQL (via Supabase), ESLint, Prettier, Storybook 8+, and testing tools (Vitest, Playwright, Testing Library).
- UI stack (Shadcn/ui, TailwindCSS, Radix UI) and development scripts are configured.
- Remaining setup:
  - Add and configure GitHub Actions for CI/CD (lint, test, build, deploy as needed).
  - Integrate Husky for pre-commit hooks (lint, type-check, test).
  - Create Docker Compose setup for local development (API, DB, Redis if needed).
- Ensure all new scripts and configs are documented in the repository README.
tasks.testStrategy:
Verify that:
- GitHub Actions pipeline runs and passes on PRs (lint, type-check, test, build).
- Husky pre-commit hooks block commits on lint/type errors.
- All services start and connect correctly via Docker Compose for local development.

subtasks.title: Configure GitHub Actions CI/CD Pipeline
subtasks.description: Set up GitHub Actions workflows for linting, type-checking, testing, and building the monorepo. Ensure the pipeline runs on PRs and main branch pushes.
subtasks.details:
<info added on 2025-07-21T09:50:58.185Z>
GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline has been fully configured with the following workflows and files:

ci.yml – Main CI pipeline (ESLint, TypeScript, Vitest, Playwright, build)
deploy.yml – Production deployment workflow (Vercel integration)
code-quality.yml – Code quality, security, and performance audits (SonarCloud, Snyk, Lighthouse)
lighthouserc.json – Lighthouse CI performance thresholds
.github/README.md – CI/CD setup guide and usage documentation

Key features:
- Automatic CI runs on PRs and pushes to main/master/develop/xono branches
- Code quality checks (lint, type-check, test)
- Automated E2E testing
- Security vulnerability scanning (npm audit, Snyk)
- Performance auditing (Lighthouse CI)
- Automatic production deployment on main branch

Additional required setup:
- Configure GitHub Secrets for environment variables (Supabase, Vercel, etc.)[1][2]
- Set branch protection rules
- Optionally link SonarCloud/Snyk accounts

CI/CD pipeline setup is complete.
</info added on 2025-07-21T09:50:58.185Z>

subtasks.title: Integrate Husky Pre-commit Hooks
subtasks.description: Add Husky to enforce pre-commit checks for lint, type-check, and tests. Ensure developers cannot commit code that fails these checks.
subtasks.details:
<info added on 2025-07-21T09:53:59.187Z>
Husky pre-commit hooks have been fully configured to enforce code quality and commit standards in the repository. The setup includes installation of husky and lint-staged as dev dependencies, husky initialization to create the .husky directory, and lint-staged rules in package.json for file-type-specific checks. The pre-commit hook is set to run ESLint, Prettier, TypeScript type checks, and tests, while the commit-msg hook enforces conventional commit message formats. Additional scripts for type-check and prepare have been added to package.json.

On commit, only staged files are checked with ESLint and Prettier, type-checking and tests are run, and commit messages are validated for conventional format. Currently, there are 318 TypeScript errors and some ESLint compatibility issues with the latest Next.js/ESLint versions, which may block commits due to pre-commit hook failures. Further work is needed to resolve TypeScript errors, address ESLint compatibility, and plan a gradual code quality improvement strategy. The base Husky pre-commit hook setup is complete.
</info added on 2025-07-21T09:53:59.187Z>

tasks.title: Database Schema & Index Implementation
tasks.description: The shop_relationships table, indexes, constraints, triggers, and audit fields are already fully implemented in Supabase. Remaining work is to synchronize the local Drizzle ORM schema files with the current Supabase schema, add seed scripts, write DB-level constraint tests, and document the schema.
tasks.details:
- Update the local Drizzle ORM schema files to exactly match the current Supabase shop_relationships table structure, including all fields, indexes, constraints, and triggers.
- Write seed scripts to generate representative test data for shop_relationships.
- Implement DB-level tests to verify all constraints and business rules (e.g., unique active relationship, referential integrity, no self-relationship, valid periods).
- Document the shop_relationships schema, including field descriptions, constraints, indexes, and business logic enforcement.
- No further migration or table creation is required; focus is on code-level synchronization and documentation.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify Drizzle schema matches Supabase via introspection and schema diff tools; run seed scripts and confirm data loads as expected; execute DB-level tests to ensure all constraints and business rules are enforced; review schema documentation for completeness and accuracy.

subtasks.title: Update Drizzle ORM schema files to match Supabase shop_relationships table
subtasks.description: Synchronize the local Drizzle schema definition with the current Supabase implementation, including all fields, indexes, constraints, and triggers.
subtasks.details:
<info added on 2025-07-21T10:01:30.070Z>
Drizzle ORM schema files have been fully updated and synchronized with the current Supabase database structure. All tables, enums, constraints, and relationships are now defined according to the latest Supabase implementation. The schema has been migrated from integer-based IDs to UUIDs, with all foreign key relationships and business rules accurately reflected. Additional fields for timestamps, auditing, and metadata have been incorporated, and support for array and JSONB types has been added. All TypeScript errors related to SQL helpers and imports have been resolved. The local Drizzle schema is now fully aligned with Supabase, ensuring consistency across development and production environments.
</info added on 2025-07-21T10:01:30.070Z>

subtasks.title: Write seed scripts for shop_relationships test data
subtasks.description: Create scripts to populate the shop_relationships table with representative test data for development and testing purposes.
subtasks.details:
<info added on 2025-07-21T10:05:14.117Z>
Test data seed scripts have been fully implemented, providing both comprehensive SQL-based and type-safe TypeScript-based seeding for the shop_relationships table. Scripts are located at db/migrations/seed-test-data.sql (SQL) and db/seed.ts (TypeScript with Drizzle ORM). New npm scripts db:seed and db:seed-sql have been added for easy execution. The seeded dataset includes 1 admin, 3 KOLs, 4 OLs, 8 approved shop owners, 3 additional shop users in pending/rejected states, 14 hierarchical relationships (KOL→OL, OL→Shop Owner), and special relationship patterns (ended, transferred, temporary). Business scenarios covered: normal hierarchy, approval workflow (pending/approved/rejected), relationship history (transferred/temporary), subordinate statistics, and diverse region distribution. Validation queries for hierarchy and relationship integrity are included. Run seeding via npm run db:seed (TypeScript) or npm run db:seed-sql (SQL).
</info added on 2025-07-21T10:05:14.117Z>

tasks.title: API Design & Implementation (Relationships CRUD & Tree)
tasks.description: All required RESTful API endpoints for relationships (list, tree, history, create/update) are fully implemented. Business logic (cycle prevention, role validation, audit logging) is robustly enforced in the service layer. No further implementation is needed.
tasks.details:
- Express 4+ with OpenAPI 3.1 spec is used for endpoint documentation.
- Endpoints implemented: GET /api/relationships, GET /api/relationships/tree, GET /api/relationships/history, POST /api/relationships.
- Request validation is handled via Zod or Joi.
- Middleware for admin authentication/authorization (JWT) is in place.
- Business rules enforced: cycle/self-reference prevention, role checks, automatic closure of existing relationships.
- Redis (v7+) is integrated for caching tree data.
- PostgreSQL CTEs are used for efficient tree queries.
- All changes are logged to an audit_log table, tracking created_by.
- Filtering, pagination, and profile JOINs are supported where appropriate.
- Tree endpoint supports recursive hierarchy, depth limiting, and sales statistics.
tasks.testStrategy: All endpoints are covered by unit and integration tests using Jest or Vitest. Tests verify business rule enforcement, error handling, authentication, and audit logging. Pagination, filtering, and tree depth/statistics are also tested.

tasks.title: Frontend Component: RelationshipTreeView
tasks.description: Build a virtualized, collapsible tree view with drag-and-drop for relationship management. Integrate real-time search, status, and performance display per node.
tasks.details:
- Use React 18+ with react-dnd (v16+) for drag-and-drop.
- Use react-window (v1.8+) or react-virtualized for large tree virtualization.
- Fetch tree data via API with lazy loading (on expand).
- Display node status (active/inactive), role-based color, and monthly sales (from API).
- Implement search with debounce and highlight.
- Provide drag feedback and error handling UI.
- Ensure accessibility (ARIA roles, keyboard navigation).
tasks.testStrategy: Write component/unit tests with React Testing Library; perform manual drag-and-drop and search scenarios; test with large datasets for performance.

tasks.title: Frontend Component: RelationshipChangeModal
tasks.description: Implement modal for changing parent relationship. Support parent search, reason input, current relationship display, and validation (cycle/self-reference prevention).
tasks.details:
- Use React 18+ with MUI or Ant Design modal/dialog.
- Integrate async search for parent selection (debounced API calls).
- Show current parent and relationship info.
- Validate input (required reason, prevent cycles/self-reference via API pre-check).
- Display error messages and allow cancel/undo.
- Ensure accessibility and responsive design.
tasks.testStrategy: Component/unit tests for modal logic; integration tests for parent search and validation; manual tests for error scenarios.

tasks.title: Frontend Component: RelationshipHistoryTable
tasks.description: Develop paginated, sortable table showing relationship change history, with before/after comparison and reason display.
tasks.details:
- Use React 18+ with MUI DataGrid or Ant Design Table.
- Fetch paginated history via API.
- Display columns: timestamp, previous parent, new parent, reason, changed by.
- Support sorting (by time), filtering (by shop/parent), and pagination.
- Highlight changes visually.
- Ensure accessibility and responsive layout.
tasks.testStrategy: Component/unit tests for table rendering; integration tests for API pagination/sorting; manual tests for large datasets.

tasks.title: Business Rule Enforcement & Validation Layer
tasks.description: Implement robust business rule enforcement: role validation, cycle/self-reference prevention, single active relationship, admin-only changes, and audit logging.
tasks.details:
- Centralize business logic in service layer (backend).
- Use graph traversal (DFS/BFS) to detect cycles before relationship changes.
- Validate roles via user profile lookup (KOL/OL only as parent).
- Enforce admin-only access via middleware.
- Log all changes with user, timestamp, and reason.
- Write reusable validation utilities with unit tests.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit/integration tests for all business rules; attempt invalid operations and verify rejection; audit log inspection.

tasks.title: Performance Optimization: Caching & Virtualization
tasks.description: Optimize API and frontend for large-scale data: Redis caching for tree data, API response optimization, frontend virtualization, and lazy loading.
tasks.details:
- Use Redis (v7+) for caching tree and frequently accessed queries.
- Implement cache invalidation on relationship changes.
- Use PostgreSQL CTEs and indexes for efficient queries.
- Frontend: ensure react-window/react-virtualized is used for large trees.
- Implement lazy loading of child nodes in tree view.
- Monitor API response times and optimize as needed.
tasks.testStrategy: Load test API endpoints (tree, history) with large datasets; measure response times; profile frontend rendering with >10,000 nodes.

tasks.title: Security & Access Control Implementation
tasks.description: Implement robust authentication (JWT/OAuth2), admin-only access to relationship management, and secure audit logging. Ensure all endpoints are protected and sensitive actions are logged.
tasks.details:
- Use Passport.js (v0.7+) or NextAuth.js for authentication.
- Restrict all relationship-changing endpoints to admin users.
- Store audit logs in a separate, immutable table.
- Regularly review and test access control policies.
- Ensure secure handling of tokens and sensitive data.
tasks.testStrategy: Penetration tests for endpoint access; attempt unauthorized actions; verify audit logs for all changes.

tasks.title: Monitoring, Logging, and Metrics Integration
tasks.description: Integrate monitoring for API performance, error tracking, and usage metrics. Track tree loading time, relationship change success, and user actions.
tasks.details:
- Use Prometheus + Grafana for API metrics (response time, error rate).
- Integrate Sentry (v7+) for error tracking (frontend/backend).
- Log key business events (relationship changes, errors) to ELK stack or similar.
- Expose metrics endpoints for dashboards.
- Track frontend usage (drag-and-drop success, search latency) via analytics (e.g., PostHog).
tasks.testStrategy: Simulate errors and slow queries; verify metrics in dashboards; check alerting for failures.
